caption.p: 1665 portrait of renowned painter, poet, and public intellectual Gérard de Lairesse (1641 to 1711), by Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn (1606 to 1669). Lairesse’s facial deformities caused him to be shunned by some contemporaries; they are now thought to have resulted from congenital syphilis. ( https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/459082; public domain.)
